NOT EXCEEDS 850. THE FUEL SHALL BE FREE FROM INORGANIC ACIDS AND FROM USED LUBRICATING OILS. THE FUEL SHOULD NOT INCLUDE ANY ADDED SUBSTANCE OR CHEMICAL WASTE WHICH JEOPARDIZES THE SAFETY OF SHIPS OR ADVERSELY AFFECTS THE PERFORMANCE OF THE MACHINERY, ETC, IN ACCORDANCE WITH CLAUSE 5 OF THE ISO 8217:2010E WHERE AND WHEN IT APPLICABLE. -MGO(DMA), MDO/DMB IN ACCORDANCE WITH ISO 8217:2010E WITH SULFUR CONTENT ACCORDING TO CURRENT SULFUR REGULATIONS IMO, EU, CALIFORNIA STATE AREAS AND VISCOSITY ABOVE 3 CST AT 40 DEGREES CELSIUS. VESSEL’S SPEED/BUNKER CONSUMPTION: SEA SPEED (LADEN/BALLAST) ABOUT 13,0/13,5 KNOTS. DAILY FUEL OIL CONSUMPTION OF MAIN ENGINE:  20 MT/DAY PLUS 2.0 MT/DAY GE FOR MANEUVER: 550 KG/HR MGO(DMA), MDO/DMB - FOR PURPOSE OF RELIABLE ENGINE OPERATION AND IN ACCORDANCE WITH CURRENT SULFUR REGULATIONS IMO, EU, CALIFORNIA STATE AREAS. THE ABOVE STATED SPEED AND BUNKER CONSUMPTION FIGURES AT SEA ARE STATED PROVIDED THE ABSENCE OF (ADVERSE) COMING CURRENT AND/OR NEGATIVE INFLUENCE OF SWELL, I.E. WHEN GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS - WIND MAXIMUM BEAUFORT FORCE 2 (UP TO 3.5 M/SEC), CALM (SWH UPTO 0.5 M) AND DEEP SEA AND PROVIDED VESSEL'S UNDERWATER HULL AND PROPELLER ARE CLEAN FROM FOULING. VESSEL'S M/E BURNS MDO/DMB WHEN MANEUVERING IN/APPROACHES NARROW OR RESTRICTED WATERS INCLUDING CANALS/RIVERS/SHALLOW WATERS/FOG CONDITIONS AND ALSO WHEN ME/GE COLD START APPLICABLE. BUNKER CONSUMPTION IN PORT: IN PORT W/O CARGO OPERATIONS – 1.5 MT HFO 380 CST PER DAY PLUS BOILER CONSUMPTION: A) 1.0 MT HFO 380 CST P/DAY WHEN OUTSIDE TEMPERATURE ABOVE 15 DEG CELSIUS B) 1.2 MT HFO 380 CST P/DAY WHEN
